title: Pulse Secure VPN (Preview)
descriptionMarkdown: The [Pulse Secure VPN](https://www.pulsesecure.net/products/pulse-connect-secure/) connector allows you to easily connect your Pulse Secure logs with Azure Sentinel, to view dashboards, create custom alerts, and improve investigations. Integrating Pulse Secure VPN with Azure Sentinel provides more insight into your organization's network and improves your security operation capabilities.

sampleQueries.query:
PulseSecureVPN 
 | where vpn_message startswith 'Login failed'
 | summarize count() by vpn_user 
 | top 10 by count_

sampleQueries.description: Top 10 Failed Logins by IP Address
sampleQueries.query:
PulseSecureVPN 
 | where vpn_message startswith 'Login failed'
 | summarize count() by client_ip 
 | top 10 by count_

dataTypes.name: Syslog (PulseSecureVPN)
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
PulseSecureVPN
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

value:
PulseSecureVPN
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

customs.name: Pulse Secure VPN
customs.description: must be configured to export logs via Syslog

instructionSteps.description: >This data connector depends on a parser based on a Kusto Function to work as expected. [Follow the steps](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/chicduong/ccd-dev/master/pulsesecurevpn_parser.txt) to use this Kusto functions alias, **PulseSecureVPN**

instructionSteps.title: 1. Install and onboard the agent for Linux
instructionSteps.description:
Typically, you should install the agent on a different computer from the one on which the logs are generated.

>  Syslog logs are collected only from **Linux** agents.

parameters.title: Choose where to install the agent:

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on Azure Linux Virtual Machine
instructionSteps.description: Select the machine to install the agent on and then click **Connect**.

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on a non-Azure Linux Machine
instructionSteps.description: Download the agent on the relevant machine and follow the instructions.

instructionSteps.title: 2. Configure the logs to be collected
instructionSteps.description:
Configure the facilities you want to collect and their severities.
 1. Under workspace advanced settings **Configuration**, select **Data** and then **Syslog**.
 2. Select **Apply below configuration to my machines** and select the facilities and severities.
 3.  Click **Save**.

instructionSteps.title: 3. Configure and connect the Pulse Secure VPN
instructionSteps.description: [Follow the instructions](https://docs.pulsesecure.net/WebHelp/Content/PCS/PCS_AdminGuide_8.2/Configuring Syslog.htm) to enable syslog streaming of Pulse Secure VPN logs. Use the IP address or hostname for the Linux device with the Linux agent installed as the Destination IP address.
